snippet: There are cases where shooting a fleeing suspect is justified — if the suspect was about to commit a serious felony or posed a serious threat — but the shooting of Walter Scott does not pass that test, experts say.
abstract: Legal experts assessing video of fatal police encounter in North Charleston, SC, say Officer Michael Slager does not appear to have justification for shooting unarmed black man Walter Scott in the back as he ran away.
lead_paragraph: There are cases where shooting a fleeing suspect is justified — if the suspect was about to commit a serious felony or posed a serious threat — but the shooting of Walter Scott does not pass that test, experts say.

headline.main: North Charleston Police Shooting Not Justified, Experts Say
headline.print_headline: Shooting of a Fleeing Unarmed Man Does Not Appear to Be Justified, Experts Say
